session.name: Invited Orals: Novel Particle Sources and Acceleration Techniques

paper.main_class: MC3: Novel Particle Sources and Acceleration Techniques
paper.title: Control of Laser Plasma Accelerated Electrons: A Route for Compact Free Electron Lasers
paper.abstract: The recent spectacular development of laser plasma ac- celerators that now can deliver GeV electron beams in an extremelyshortdistancemakesthemverypromising. Ap- plications for light sources based on undulator radiation and free electron laser appear as an intermediate step to move from an acceleration concept to an accelerator qual- ification. However, the presently achieved divergence and energy spread require some electron beam manipulations. The COXINEL test line was designed for enabling Free Elec- tron Laser operation with baseline reference parameters. It comprises variable permanent magnet quadrupoles for di- vergence handling, a magnetic chicane for electron energy sorting, a second set of quadrupole for chromatic focusing and an undulator for synchrotron radiation emission and/or free electron laser gain medium. The transport along the line is controlled [1]. The synchrotron radiation emitted by the undulator radiation is studied under different conditions of detection (CCD camera, spectrometer), electron beam manipulation and undulator parameters. These observations pave the way towards Laser Plasma Acceleration based Free Electron Laser.
paper.footnote: [1] T. André et al., Control of laser plasma accelerated electrons for light sources, accepted in Nature Comm.

abstract_log.comments: Dear Author, I have made you red for the following reasons: 1) you are an invited oral which allows you 5 pages and you can go to 6 if the page is just references -- BUT you are 7 pages, so you are way over. 2) the table captions are below the table, JACoW style is for the table caption to be above the table. 3) I am unable to find a reference to reference 30 in the text. Please make these corrections and upload new files. Thank you, Jana (TRIUMF)

Dear Author, thank you for taking the time to correct your paper. I mistakenly didn't ask you to also fix the table captions. Table captions are to be in initial caps, with no period. I have done this for you. I have come across a line that I believe was an error caused when chopping out some text. On page 4, there is a stray reference, there is a % in front and I think a typo was injected and LATeX got confused. Please look at page 4, the right side column at the end of the last line before the heading "THE MEASURED UNDULATOR ..." I have left the % in front which has removed \cite{OumbarekAP}. Therefore the instance of Ref. 25 at this spot is commented out. If this needs to be active let me know. Jana, TRIUMF

The new version si fine for me.
Yours
In PDF, removed some extra periods from author list.

Dear Author, I made many changes to your PPTX file to produce WEZPLS1.PDF which will be used in the proceedings. Please have a look over WEZPLS1.PDF for any corrections. If you have any questions or concerns, email me at pdyer@bnl.gov.

Dear Author, Apologies for the previous mixup. You should see WEZPLS1_TALK.PDF in your files now. This contains the slides that will be included in the proceedings. They were created from your original WEZPLS1_TALK.PPTX with many modifications. Please have a look over WEZPLS1_TALK.PDF for any corrections. If you have any questions or concerns, please email me at pdyer@bnl.gov.

paper.main_class: MC3: Novel Particle Sources and Acceleration Techniques
paper.title: High Transformer Ratio Plasma Wakefield Acceleration Driven by Photocathode Laser Shaped Electron Bunches
paper.abstract: Beam driven wakefield acceleration (PWFA) schemes in plasmas are among the most promising candidates for novel, compact accelerators. Several aspects of PWFA are under investigation at the Photoinjector Test facility at DESY in Zeuthen (PITZ). One of the main characteristics of these accelerators is the ratio between field strength usable for acceleration and decelerating field strength in the driver bunch, the so called transformer ratio. To reach high transformer ratios usually shaped bunches, e.g. with ramped current profiles are employed as drivers. The so-called self-modulation instability, which causes transverse modulation of a bunch longer than the plasma wavelength, is proposed as a means of supplying short driver bunches for proton-driven PWFA. This talk will give an overview on experimental results in these two aspects of PWFA at PITZ with a focus on the production of electron bunches enabling high transformer ratio acceleration by shaping the photocathode laser pulses of a photoinjector and the demonstration of high transformer ratio PWFA. Simulations and further developments on the shaping techniques, allowing highly flexible electron bunches for future plasma wakefield accelerators are also presented.

abstract_log.comments: Dear Speaker, Your PowerPoint slides were successfully converted to PDF and will be published in the conference proceedings. Please download the PDF slides file (WEZPLS2_TALK.pdf) and check that all is OK. In case of problems, please contact: Jan.chrin@psi.ch Thank you.

Dear author, thank you for your submission. Editor found a small number of formatting issues. The reference section is outstanding but differs slightly from the JACoW standard. So the following changes have been made to the source of the paper to conform to the JACoW template. # TC02 Text formatting wrong: missing required indentation for paragraphs by using "\\" to get a new paragraph. Just do it the standard LaTeX way by leaving an empty line in between paragraphs # TC06 Reference formatting: editor changed \begin{thebibliography}{9} to {99} because there are 40 references and the alignment was wrong # TC06 References incorrect: Reference numbers out of sequence: 1-4, 6, 7, 10, 11, 8, 9, 11-15, 19, 20, 16-18, 21-23, 5, 24-40; references have to be ordered in sequence => reordered # TC06 Reference formatting: journal names should be typeset in italics # TC10 Graphics: most figures didn't had the fonts embedded therefore all figures redistilled with font inclusion, new files uploaded. # TC12 Unit formatting: units are printed in roman (upright) fonts (IUPAC rule of 1999), therefore some ps and cm removed from math mode
set to GREEN (as these were minor errors) for preparations of next Pre-Press release
